title: Business Analyst
description:
Hi there! We're PAR and our purpose is:


**To deliver solutions that connect people to the restaurants, meals and moments they love.**



We take that responsibility very seriously. As a leading provider of technology to the top restaurant brands in the world we're calling all rebels, instigators, idealists and builders to join our constantly growing team!



PAR invented the first standalone point of sale terminal over 40 years ago, yet we operate much like a start-up at the forefront of restaurant technology. Today, our solutions span Customer loyalty, engagement, restaurant management, payment services, drive-thru, and full POS integrations. These solutions are used to serve tens of millions of guests every day in over 120 countries.



Our mission is to build the number one restaurant technology company in the world and we're off to great start.



We believe that our ambition is only limited by our ability to attract and retain great people; people who are up for the challenge to change the game with us! If it sounds like you belong here, we should meet!

 **Position Description**

As a Business Analyst at PAR, a leader in restaurant technology, you will play a crucial role in shaping the future of dining experiences through innovative tech solutions. Your expertise will directly contribute to enhancing our products and services, which include state-of-the-art POS systems, customer engagement tools, and mobile ordering applications.


*As we continue our flexible workplace arrangements, it is crucial for our employees to ensure they have a reliable internet and cellular connection in place. Strong and stable connectivity in our work locations allows for smooth communication, seamless collaboration, and uninterrupted productivity.*


**Position Location**



Remote


**Pay Band**



The base salary range for this position is $87,300 to $131,497 USD per year commensurate with work location, experience, skills, certifications, education and prior accomplishments. This position may be eligible for additional compensation including a bonus, commission and/or equity as applicable.


**What We're Looking For**


* Proven track record of success in business analysis, preferably in the technology or hospitality sector.
* Advanced proficiency in data analysis software (e.g., SQL, Excel, BI tools).
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management software (e.g., Jira, Asana).
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage effectively with diverse stakeholder groups.
* Innovative thinker with a passion for technology and its application in the restaurant industry.


**What You will Do and Be Responsible For**



* **In-Depth Data Analysis:** Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to delve into complex datasets. Identify key performance indicators relevant to the restaurant industry and use these metrics to drive business decisions.


* **Business Process Optimization:** Conduct comprehensive evaluations of business operations. Develop and implement strategies that streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and optimize the use of technology in restaurant settings.


* **Client-Centric Requirements Gathering:** Work closely with clients to understand their unique needs and challenges. Translate these requirements into detailed, actionable plans for the development team, ensuring that our solutions are perfectly tailored to our clients' needs.


* **Advanced Stakeholder Communication:** Engage with stakeholders at all levels, from C-suite executives to end-users. Tailor your communication style to each audience, ensuring clarity and effectiveness in conveying complex technical concepts.


* **Innovative Market Research:** Continuously explore emerging trends in both the restaurant industry and technology sector. Leverage this knowledge to propose innovative features and enhancements for our products.


* **Comprehensive User Training and Support:** Develop extensive training programs and documentation for users of our technology. Provide exceptional ongoing support, resolving issues efficiently to ensure customer satisfaction.


* **Collaboration with Development Teams:** Work hand-in-hand with software developers and engineers. Ensure that the technical aspects of our solutions align seamlessly with business requirements and customer expectations.


* **Feedback Analysis and Implementation:** Regularly collect and analyze user feedback. Use this information to make data-driven recommendations for product improvements and enhancements.


* **Risk Management:** Identify potential risks in business operations and technology implementations. Develop and execute mitigation strategies to minimize impact on project outcomes.



**Why We Need You (Skill and Abilities)**



We are looking for the following skillset and abilities to succeed in this position.


* **Analytical Skills:** The ability to analyze large sets of data, interpret complex information, and draw meaningful conclusions is crucial. This involves understanding data trends, identifying patterns, and making data-driven decisions.
* **Problem-Solving Abilities**: The role demands strong problem-solving skills to identify issues in business processes and develop effective solutions. This includes the ability to think creatively and strategically.
* **Communication Skills**: Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for presenting findings, explaining complex concepts in simple terms, and engaging with stakeholders at all levels, including technical staff, management, and non-technical users.
* **Client-Centric Approach**: Understanding client needs and translating them into actionable technical requirements is key. This involves active listening, empathy, and the ability to maintain strong client relationships.
* **Adaptability and Flexibility:** The technology and restaurant industries are both fast evolving. Being adaptable and open to change is important for staying relevant and effective in the role.
* **Teamwork and Collaboration**: Success in this role often depends on the ability to work well in a team, collaborating effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
* **Attention to Detail**: Precision and attention to detail are vital, especially when dealing with complex data and when ensuring that business requirements are accurately translated into technical specifications.
* **Continuous Learning**: A willingness to continuously learn and stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices is essential in this rapidly evolving field.
* **Organizational Skills**: Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively, are important for handling multiple projects and deadlines.


**Who We Are**

At PAR, we believe we will win or lose, through the culture we build.



Our culture is built on 4 values.


* Speed – we are the kind of people who do not wait for the elevator
* Ownership – we want owners, not renters
* Focus – success is built from focusing on what matters most
* Winning Together – for PAR to win, we need our customers, our employees, our suppliers, our shareholders, and our community to succeed


We believe by committing to these values (and more) we can build a cultural spirit that, combined with our products, will create years of long-term success.



PAR is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, citizenship, genetic information, status as a protected veteran, marital status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable laws.

  


PAR is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We also provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, please visit the US Department of Labor's website.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer, L5, Cloud Games Developer Tools
description:
Remote, United States
You may have seen the news that Netflix is getting into gaming; this is your chance to be a key part of it! We are a growing team building a cloud games platform that aims to bring Netflix games to our subscribers on a variety of devices beyond mobile phones.  

We are looking for an engineer specializing in identifying and building developer workflows and tooling who will serve as a key contributor to creating the suite of tools that make fast iteration and development of games for our platform a delight.**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Help define, scope, and plan development of game developer tools
* Build new tools and integrate existing development tools to work with our platform
**This role is a fit if you:**
------------------------------

* Take pride in building high-quality tools for developers
* Love working on early stage projects where your contributions make a big difference
* Thrive in an environment with lots of context and minimal guidance
* Enjoy collaborating with engineers across functional teams
* Are a self-starter with excellent communication skills
**Qualifications:**
-------------------

* 8+ years of full stack development experience
* Experience with Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript, go language and React
* Experience developing tools for developers
* Experience working with game development and engines such as Unity and Unreal
**Nice to have:**
-----------------

* Experience with the Electron framework

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $170,000 - $720,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. *We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.*

title: Senior Game Designer Remote
description:
**Mob Entertainment** is a startup multimedia studio that is best known for our hit indie horror game "**Poppy Playtime"**. Poppy Playtime is one of hottest new properties in gaming, and our team is naturally expanding as our ambition expands. To give a taste of our brand's popularity, Poppy Playtime had 7.5 billion views of Huggy Wuggy videos on YouTube.


As a Senior Game Designer at Mob, you'll assist in pioneering a new & exciting venture, as we work on an original singleplayer title in the sci-fi/comedy/action genre. You'll work closely with the Game Director to ideate new & innovative game mechanics, on a mission to break the norms of media and create a game that you'll be proud of for years to come.  



RESPONSIBILITIES:
* Ideate new & innovative game mechanics
* Design & refine the specific nuts & bolts of said mechanics
* Collaborate with writers to ensure that the narrative & game design are in tandem
* Prototype your designs in Unreal Engine 5 using Blueprint and/or C++
* Utilize programmers & artists on your team to rapidly prototype your designs
* Analyze the game's strengths & weaknesses by conducting regular playtests
* Refine your design based on playtesting

  



REQUIREMENTS:
* 5+ years industry experience
* Deep understanding of how to abstractly breakdown games into their subsequent mechanics/components/game loops
* UE Blueprinting
* Excellent writing, communication & interpersonal skills

  



OUR CORE VALUES:
* Storytelling
* Quality
* Obsession
* Creativity
* Subversion
* Collaboration
* Scrappiness

  



EMPLOYEE EXPECTATIONS:
* Kindness
* Result-Oriented
* Autonomy
* Efficiency
* Humility
* Be real.
* Be weird.


#LI-Remote


Mob Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or religious creed, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, marital status, family or parental status, disability, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. All employment decisions are based on a person's merit, business needs, and role requirements. If you require further accommodations or have questions regarding accessibility of our roles, please reach out to info@mobentertainment.com

title: Senior Technical Game Designer
description:
That's No Moon is an independent studio of storytellers and game-makers who believe in the power of narrative-driven experiences. With a diverse team of talented developers, from some of the top game studios in the world (Naughty Dog, Infinity Ward, Bungie), our shared vision is to create the future of AAA experiences with a culture of creativity, collaboration, and responsible production practices. Our passionate team of developers help shape our studio, our projects, and our future.


We are looking for hardworking, Senior Technical Game Designer to focus on creating systems, mechanics, prototypes, workflows and pipelines. You will work with experienced developers to push innovation, agency, quality, and fidelity for next-gen gameplay and storytelling.



Responsibilities:


* As part of a highly skilled and lean design team that believes in self-sufficiency, the Senior Technical Designer's responsibilities will include creating new mechanics, systems, event scripting, and interactive objects.
* Work with engineering, animation and design teams to implement content, solve workflow issues, and create content pipelines.
* We believe in ownership, so the more of your vision that you can prototype with your own skills, the better.
* We also believe in open communication and collaboration – use your skills to communicate your vision to the rest of the team and get all the departments pumped to collaborate with you!
* You will also work with producers to plan out and prioritize your development schedule. Know what the most important parts of your design are and have plans to reduce scope if something takes longer than expected.


Requirements & Skills:


* Experience with text based scripting and programming languages (eg. XML, PERL, C++)
* Knowledge of and interest in the type of game we are making.
* Knowledge of Unreal engine a plus.
* Knowledge of art packages such as Maya, Max, and the Adobe suite a plus.


Qualities:


* Have a cinematic eye! Conceptualize and pitch game systems and mechanics. Communicate clearly and visually to the Directors and the team.
* Have ownership of your content. Once design have been approved, the Senior Technical Game Designer will be responsible for these features to ship.
* Be creative. We don't want to micromanage. Nothing makes us happier than seeing you prototype ideas we would have never conceptualized.
* Be proactive. Don't wait to be assigned a task – pitch concepts that you believe will make the game better and pitch them regularly.
* Be a generalist. Learn whatever skills will help you complete your vision. From making prototype assets, to animation, VFX, mocap, audio, etc – a designer is a versatile person. You will have stellar artists and engineers to help you, but the more you can present a singular vision to us with your prototype work, the more excited we will get about it!
* Be responsible. You will be checking in script and level content without review. It's your job not to break the build


*TNM considers a number of factors when determining each role's base pay range, including industry benchmarks, location, experience, and other job specific skills. In addition to base pay, this role may be eligible for other incentive compensation including equity and profit share. The estimated base pay range for this role is U.S. only and not applicable for locations outside of the U.S.*

  

*The estimated base pay range for this role is:* *$130,000 - $175,000*

*TNM offers competitive and comprehensive benefits that include medical, dental, vision, 401(k) match, flexible PTO, supplemental life and disability, and more. Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary based on country of residence and/or part-time or temporary employment status.*

title: Software Engineer, Gameplay
description:
Snail Games strives to create the new high bar for gameplay experience in online gaming. We have been a global developer and publisher of digital entertainment since 2009 and are committed to pushing the boundaries of the industry. We are looking for a talented Gameplay Engineer with experience in Unreal. You’ll team up with artists, designers, and other engineers to bring ideas into reality. Come join our team and be at the forefront of something truly great.



Job Type: Full-Time



Location: **This position is fully remote but limited to applicants residing in Alaska, Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Maine, Missouri, New Jersey, Nevada, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas, Washington, and Wyoming.**

  

### **Responsibilities:**


* Develop, troubleshoot, and enhance major systems using C/C++ and other programming languages within a sizable cross-platform codebase.
* Lead the creation of innovative gameplay experiences.
* Contribute to the formulation of game architecture, technical designs, and postmortems.
* Conduct thorough data and code analysis to identify opportunities for enhancement.
* Collaborate effectively with a team of programmers, artists, and designers to conceptualize, prototype, and implement gameplay features.


### **Minimum Requirements:**


* A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in a gameplay engineering role or a similar position, with a history of contributing to multiple successfully launched titles.
* Expertise with UE4 or UE5. With a minimum of 3 years professional experience using Unreal.
* Advanced understanding of algorithms and data structures.
* Proficient in optimization techniques and debugging.
* Strong mathematical skills, particularly in linear algebra and 3D vector math.
* In-depth knowledge of game design principles and a solid understanding of various game genres.
* Enthusiasm and passion for crafting exceptional video game experiences.


### **Nice to Have:**


* Specialized programming skills, such as low-level network programming, High-Level Shader Language (HLSL), SSE assembly, etc.
* Expertise and keen interest in one or more of the following areas: AI, User Interfaces, Animation, or General Gameplay.


### **COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS**



Salary Range: **$110,000 - 130,000 per year**. Pay offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, and business or organizational needs.



For regular full-time employees we offer a package of benefits including paid time off (max 104 hours per year, prorate your first year), up to 80 hours per calendar year of sick time, 12 paid company holidays per year, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, and 401(k) with company match.

title: Senior Gameplay Engineer
description:
**About Squanch Games:**
========================



Since opening our doors in 2016, we've recruited a troop of the most hilariously unique talent the biz has to offer. We're constantly looking to expand our team of incredible people: They're crackin' some jokes, making awesomely strange stuff, and thinking outside the box simultaneously - that's the "Squanch Factor" if you will.



At Squanch Games, we make dreams come true – the funkiest, bizarrest dreams from the depths of our souls. Real complex stuff, but you probably know what we’re talking about because you’ve already played our games, right? RIGHT? (Hint: YES).



If you see molds and like breaking them, or boxes and enjoy stepping outside of them–ONWARD! Also, if you love working remotely, we're the studio for you.



Think you've got what it takes? Go for it. Seriously! Send us your resume!



**Senior Gameplay Engineer**
============================


**What you'll do:**
-------------------



As the Senior Gameplay Engineer at Squanch Games, you will help own and drive the development of Gameplay Experiences and Systems: partnering closely with design, animation, audio, VFX, QA, and production to deliver features and content from prototypes to final quality.



Every day, you will be working as part of a cross-disciplinary team to further the development of gameplay systems and features.



You will be a go-to for creating and improving our enemy AI behaviors, combat / weapons, and boss encounters.



But you know that already! You’ve successfully done this role at another studio, and now you’re looking for a role with more opportunity to flex your creative muscles.



**In this role, you will:**
---------------------------


* Solve complex problems and you are always willing to track down answers when no solutions are readily available.
* Collaboratively design, implement, and refine weapons and enemy encounter experiences.
* Prototype complex features and suggest improvements that would elevate gameplay.
* Maintain constant contact with other departments so that their feedback is properly taken into account.
* Continually help push for quality and create gameplay systems utilizing your knowledge of modern game technology.
* Provide support and mentorship to other engineers: take time to answer questions, review code, and build up the skill sets of other members of the team.


**What we’re looking for:**
---------------------------


* You have a solid understanding of C++ and 3D Maths such as vectors, matrixes, and quaternions.
* Experience working on console or PC games through a full development cycle, from pre-production to release as an Engineer.
* An engineer with a designer brain: You can support the design team with suggestions and knowledge of best practices in order to avoid unnecessary missteps.
* A strong familiarity with prototyping and implementing enemies, bosses, weapons, and / or combat systems.
* Someone with the ability to see the bigger picture and relationship between player weapons and enemy encounter design to create fun and unique experiences.
* You have shipped a title(s) with Unreal Engine or another AAA game engine.
* You have a passion for games: you know what's going on in the world of games, and can't wait to talk to others about it!


**Benefits:**
-------------


* Salary range: $156,000 to $187,000 depending on experience
* Health, dental & vision insurance
* Short term & long term disability insurance coverage
* Paid parental leave
* 401k and FSA
* Unlimited PTO & flexible schedule
* Completely remote studio
* Bonus to ensure a comfortable work from home setup
* Monthly snack box
* Monthly stipend for WFH expenses

**Location:**
-------------



We are a fully remote studio operating from all over the United States! While we haven't hit all 50, we encourage applicants from across the country to apply and help us complete our map.


**Equal Employment Opportunity:**
---------------------------------



Squanch Games provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, creed, marital status, registered partner or civil union status, disability status, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.



This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Senior Content Designer, PEP-C Enablement
description:
Remote, United States
Design
Netflix is seeking an experienced content designer to work on enterprise tools.  

About our Enterprise Teams
Enterprise teams design the B2B tools that our business needs to thrive and enable the member experience. Our teams work with internal stakeholders, external developers and partners integrating with Netflix platforms, and content creators helping to produce the next big hit. As a content designer in the enterprise space, you’ll join a team of stunning designers dedicated to supporting our diverse user base. These teams are at the heart of Netflix’s journey to develop the world’s most modern, creative and innovative streaming experience.  

About the Role
This role will focus on our partnership enablement tools, helping partners integrate with Netflix. This is a unique role at the intersection of storytelling, technology, and business. As an enterprise content designer, you’ll help set and elevate the Content Design vision and strategy, codify terminology, define copy style and patterns, and craft UI copy for a diverse audience. You’ll also create best practices and guidelines that scale.  

The ideal candidate will have experience in content design/content strategy, UX writing, and technical writing, with the ability to multitask while working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. They’ll be self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail. They’ll work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ingest and synthesize complex technical information. They’ll also be able to prioritize their work, communicate effectively, and represent their work to key stakeholders.**About You**
-------------

* You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and in training and business settings.
* You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, language frameworks, and design systems.
* You’re comfortable working with technical partners to ingest and synthesize highly complex information, turning technical jargon into user-friendly content that is consistent and legible for the various B2B audiences (e.g. producers, legal, game developers, sales executives, etc.)
* You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions.
* You’re able to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX for a specific audience.
* You possess a keen sense of empathy for B2B audiences and a deep desire to mine opportunities in the space.
* You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 6+ years of relevant writing experience: UX writing, content design, technical writing, taxonomy, and information architecture.
* Demonstrated experience synthesizing business requirements and technical logic into UI content for enterprise tooling and applications.
* Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules.
* Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them.
* Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution.
* Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team.

This full-time, salaried position reports to the partnership enablement Content Design Manager.  

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.  

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $120,000-515,00.  

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: Jr. Unity Developer
description:
**Status:** Full-Time, Exempt

**Location:** Remote or Virginia Beach, VA

**Start date:** Immediate Hire

**NOTE:** Candidate **MUST be located in the United States**

**Background:** Vectrona is developing cutting-edge AI/ML-based modeling & simulation systems, serious games, and 3D data visualization solutions to help warfighters train and operate. We require a skilled Junior Unity Developer to support development, deployment, and operation of our simulation systems. The Junior Unity Developer will work with the software development team in the creation of multiple software projects to ensure program objectives are accomplished.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with senior developers and subject matter experts to understand requirements and design specifications.
* Implement game mechanics, user interfaces, and interactive features from software architecture documents using .NET and Unity.
* Integrate with backend systems, to manage user data, progress tracking, and analytics.
* Integrate multimedia assets, including 3D models, animations, and audio, into the game environment.
* Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following established coding standards and best practices.
* Collaborate with QA testers to identify and fix bugs, performance issues, and other technical problems.
* Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously improve development processes and techniques.

**Requirements and Qualifications**

* **Preferred Education/Degree:** BS in computer science, computer engineering or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Proficiency in C# programming language and .NET framework.
* Comfortable with Unity engine.
* Experience with version control platforms.
* Experience with game assets (meshes, animations, materials, audio).
* Experience in organizing or conducting in game Jams or similar collaborative projects, or personal projects.
* Experience with speech recognition engines and natural language processing.
* Experience with Azure cloud services including data storage, data retrieval, authentication of users, and machine learning services.
* Fundamental understanding of machine learning.

**Preferred Knowledge and Skills:**

* Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, motivation to maintain and improve development standards.
* Ability to succeed in dynamic and demanding environment.
* Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view
* 10-20% CONUS travel may be required

VECTRONA IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND A DRUG-FREE WORKPLACE.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position.

All Vectrona employment is contingent upon the individual providing legal proof of identity and authorization to work in the United States and satisfactory background check results.

Employment with Vectrona is “at will” in accordance with Federal/State laws.

Vectrona provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applications for employment. In addition to federal law requirements, Vectrona complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching

* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

* Bachelor's (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Character Artist
description:
**WE ARE GAMEMAKERS**


**Who We Are:**



We are a team of developers with a uniting passion for crafting highly engaging entertainment with a commitment to putting fans first. Our core values are our North Star ever reminding us who we intend to be and what we strive to create. Our studio culture is built on the belief that the more varied voices in our collective story the stronger our team and our game will be. We are an association of diverse game makers driven by a passion for our art and inspired by a culture of inclusivity to build games that thrill players everywhere.



As a Senior Character Artist, you will form the next generation of diverse and innovative characters through the creation of high and low poly models. Working with designers, engineers, and artists, you will establish pipelines and produce assets that are both beautiful and technically sound. Your ability to adapt in the face of artistic and technical challenges will push the team forward. Your knowledge of form, color, and design will bring life and energy to characters that will be loved by players for years to come. With passion for your craft and attention to detail, you will shape a fantastic new game that you and the team around you can be proud of.


**Responsibilities:**


* Consistently create high quality Character Art assets that satisfy both artistic and technical requirements
* Receive and provide art and design feedback based on high level direction
* Work closely with art leads
* Support the Art team through the construction of pipelines and style guides
* Improve your craft through collaboration and self-guided exploration
* Assist in character concept and design
* Mentor and train less experienced colleagues
* Produce high quality materials for presentation purposes.


**Required Qualifications:**


* Excellent understanding of anatomy, weight, and silhouette
* Advanced knowledge of Maya, or similar 3D modeling software
* Expert sculpting skills using Zbrush
* Robust knowledge of game asset optimization and topology
* 5+ years of experience in the video games industry with 2+ shipped titles as a Character Artist
* Understanding of rigging and skinning
* Experience with Marvelous Designer
* Strong understanding of clothing and hardware
* Proficient in Unreal 5 workflows and PBR pipelines using Substance Painter/Designer
* Basic knowledge of animation, with an eye for posing
* An extensive portfolio of high and low poly models, including advanced material and rendering samples.
* Strong communication skills and ability to illustrate ideas
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Excel in highly collaborative, feedback driven environments
* Proactive about troubleshooting and problem solving
* Passion for games and game development


The pay range for this position in California at the start of employment is expected to be between $90,000 and $135,000 per year. However, base pay offered is based on market location and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.



SECURITY NOTICE - We have recently been made aware of increasing occurrences of bad actors posing as company HR personnel to gain information from "potential candidates", in the form of job interviews and offers. These scams can be quite sophisticated and appear legitimate.


***Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com and thirtyfirstunion.com accounts.***



If you believe you have been a victim of such a scam, you may fill out a complaint form at https://complaint.ic3.gov/ and https://reportfraud.ftc.gov/ detailing as much as possible. We are taking these matters very seriously and apologize for any inconvenience.
